document.docAuthor: Niu, Ze-Qing, Yuan, Feng, Ascher, John S., Kasparek, Max, Orr, Michael C., Griswold, Terry & Zhu, Chao-Dong
document.docTitle: Anthidium (Anthidium) tasitiense Niu & Yuan & Ascher & Kasparek & Orr & Griswold & Zhu 2020, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Bees of the genus Anthidium Fabricius, 1804 (Hymenoptera: Apoidea: Megachilidae: Anthidiini) from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Bees of the genus Anthidium Fabricius, 1804 (Hymenoptera: Apoidea: Megachilidae: Anthidiini) from China

heading.emphasis:
Anthidium ( Anthidium ) tasitiense Niu & Zhu
, sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis : T7 ( Fig. 33c ), clypeus ( Fig. 32b ) and maculations on terga ( Fig. 33b ) of the new species is similar to those of
A. ( A. ) punctatum Latreille, 1809
, but the new species can be distinguished from
A. ( A. ) punctatum Latreille, 1809
by the spiculum of S8 not elongate, slightly narrower than disc ( Fig. 33f ) and anterior surface of antennal scape yellow ( Fig. 32b ).

Type material:
Holotype , ♂ , China , Xinjiang : Tacheng , Yumin Xian , Tasiti ( 45º33′N , 82º18′E ),
1109 m
,
9.VIII.2016
, leg. Chao-Dong ZHU and Dan ZHANG
;
Paratypes : 1 ♂ , China , Xinjiang : Shihezi Shi , Mosuowan ( 44º29′N , 86º09′E ),
350 m
,
7.VIII.2016
, leg. Ze-Qing NIU and Qing-Tao WU
.
Etymology : The holotype location Tasiti ( China , Xinjiang ) is given as the specific name.
